page.title: 08THE NEW VICAR
page.content: We moved into the village at the beginning of{January}and two days after we had lots of snow. The children enjoyed playing in the snow but it was a bit lonely because as it was so cold nobody came out of their houses. As time went on,we began to realise what a friendly place Marsh Gibbon was and people were willing to help us when we had frozen pipes and other problems caused by the bad weather. On one of my first Sundays I had to go to a church in another village,and on the way home I skidded off the road. I went to the nearest farmhouse and the farmer got his tractor out and pulled me out of the ditch on to the road again. I tried to be a bit more careful when driving in the snow after that.
